root: ^WEEPING CLERIC: We face failure! How dare we yet breathe while the Perfect One suffers below…
^SMILING CLERIC: No, brother, we face success! The Perfect One has taken the city and dragged it beneath the lofty reaches of our sacred spire!
^THINKING CLERIC: We may still face either fate, my kin, but be aware, a fallen cleric listens.
^WEEPING: Do you come to beg forgiveness?
^SMILING: Do you come to share our mirth?
^PLAYER: You look between each face, crossing your arms.

s: ^PLAYER: I seek a setting sun on your god.
^PLAYER: I seek nothing but safe passage below.

ADoomedQuest: ^SMILING: Of course, disgraced one, you may pass into our lord's lair and meet his children. May it rekindle your faith.
TrulyDisgraced: ^SMILING: And what a grand promise! There will be equally grand humor in your failure.
^THINKING: Poor heretic... we will speak to you no longer. Your empty words waste time which could have been spent in silence.
GoForth: ^THINKING: Asitotheh ko’ila pri’on anikoli, may you fear that which possesses powerful senses, foolish child. Now, fi,
